problem.markdown: Which of the following expressions give the rate of work done to push the fluid at the inlet in a control volume? (P is pressure, m is mass, ρ is density, v is velocity and V is volume. The dot over a letter is for time rate of change of that variable and the subscripts in and out are for the inlet and outlet) [x] [mathjaxinline]\frac{P_{in}\dot{m_{in}}} {\rho_{in}}[/mathjaxinline] [ ] [mathjaxinline]\frac{P_{out}\dot{m_{out}}} {\rho_{out}} [/mathjaxinline] [x] [mathjaxinline]P_{in}A_{in}v_{in}[/mathjaxinline] [x] [mathjaxinline]P_{in}\dot{V_{in}}[/mathjaxinline] [explanation] Use volume rate is area x velocity and also use mass conservation to get all three. [explanation]
problem.p: Which of the following expressions give the rate of work done to push the fluid at the inlet in a control volume? (P is pressure, m is mass, ρ is density, v is velocity and V is volume.
